name: prorogation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the action of temporarily stopping the activities of a legislature (= law-making group): the prorogation of Parliament Prorogations should not be called for political purposes. See
prorogue
More examplesFewer examplesIt proved impossible to pass the bill before prorogation.Prorogation is used occasionally to introduce a new legislative agenda.The assembly reconvened after two months of prorogation.
